title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.8.44 | 14-03-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.summary: The lecture begins with traditional Vaishnava prayers and mantras.

segments.key_quote: The Lord, thus hearing the prayers of Kunti Devi composed in choice words for his glimpsing power.
segments.summary: The speaker introduces the verse from Srimad Bhagavatam (1.8.44) and explains the context of Kunti's prayers and Krishna's smile as acceptance.

segments.key_quote: Ultimately, Krishna is always the source of everything.
segments.summary: The speaker explains that Krishna is the source of everything, and that conditioned souls are enchanted by Krishna's mystic powers.

segments.key_quote: Yet, the Supreme Lord is satisfied by the prayers offered by different pure devotees, because the prayers are offered by his.
segments.summary: The speaker contrasts the enchantment of devotees with that of conditioned souls, emphasizing Krishna's pleasure with sincere prayers, even if imperfect.
The speaker uses the analogy of a father pleased by a child's broken language to illustrate Krishna's acceptance of sincere prayers, and introduces the concept of Maya as both illusion and mercy.

segments.key_quote: If Krishna is pleased and even smiles a little, then the whole universe will be pleased.
segments.summary: The speaker elaborates on Krishna's mercy and the idea that pleasing Krishna leads to universal satisfaction, as the universe is part and parcel of Him.

segments.key_quote: Similarly, till Krishna is pleased. You cannot make the whole world happy. Not possible.
segments.summary: Using the analogy of satisfying hunger to illustrate the importance of pleasing Krishna, the speaker emphasizes Krishna's central role in creation.

segments.key_quote: So, when you forget Krishna, that is maya.
segments.summary: The speaker explains that Krishna is the source of both material and spiritual creation, and defines Maya as the forgetfulness of Krishna.

segments.key_quote: So, when we come to Krishna consciousness, then there is no more maya.
segments.summary: The speaker discusses Krishna's presence in every atom and heart, and how Krishna consciousness helps overcome Maya, emphasizing the importance of offering prayers with feeling and following the example of great devotees like Kunti.
